questions.question_text:
A company uses a legacy finance application that runs on a single SQL Server instance. The company plans to implement Dynamics 365 Finance. The following table describes the current implementation and design decisions for the new implementation:
//IMG//

You need to identify the gap in the migration plan.
Which requirement should you identify as a gap?

Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
A company with multiple legal entities implements Dynamics 365 Finance.
You need to recommend options to ensure that you can provide customized financial reporting across the legal entities.
Solution: Create separate cost centers to manage operations.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content: yes because Cost center - An operating unit in which managers are accountable for budgeted and actual expenditures. It is used for the management and operational control of business processes that span legal entities.

It is related to consolidation or reporting accross the companies, which is only supported business unit wise:

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/finance/general-ledger/generating-consolidated-financial-statements#single-level-and-multilevel-consolidations-across-legal-entities

Still cost centers are considered as operation units: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/fin-ops/organization-administration/plan-organizational-hierarchy So the answer maybe Yes in fact

comments.content:
The types of operating units include cost centers, business units, value streams, departments, and commerce channels. 
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/fin-ops/organization-administration/organizations-organizational-hierarchies

discussion.content: Seems correct. Cost center and departments are to separate reporting, not management of things

comments.content: Agreed, ER doesn't require a developer

discussion.content: B, C, D are correct. Financial reports are never customer-facing documents.

Selected Answer: BCD
Financial report are not customer facing and SSRS requires devs

Selected Answer: BCD
BCD are correct

BCD is correct. this is the definition from Microsoft: The Electronic reporting engine is targeted at business users instead of developers. Because you configure formats instead of code, the processes for creating and adjusting formats for electronic documents are faster and easier.

ER does not require development, so it fits. On the other hand, ER documents are not intende to be printed (they won't be "customer-facing" documents) - they are sent in a digital form.

That's why I'll bet on B, C, E.

The company no in-house developer, meaning no one know how to develop reports.
Excel, Word and Finance Operation are User-driven report which can be done without any technical or developer Expertise.
SSRS Reports and Electronic Reporting need Developer Expertise
I think that customer-facing documents refer to reports, so, according to docs, B, C and E( management reporter) are the ones that don't require a developer
BCD is the correct answer.

In fact, MS seems to think that ER is used by business users: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/analytics/general-electronic-reporting. In that case ER is more customer facing, so more correct then financial reports.
ER is more developer focussed I think. I would take Excel, Word and Financial reports

questions.question_text:
A company needs to create customer-facing documents in Dynamics 365 Finance.
The company does not have an in-house developer.
You need to determine a solution for creating the documents.
Which three tools should you recommend? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

HOTSPOT -
A customer is implementing Dynamics 365 Finance and Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management.
The customer wants to use this implementation to standardize business processes.
You need to perform a gap analysis and recommend how to address the gaps.
Which functionality should you recommend for each requirement? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
A company with multiple legal entities implements Dynamics 365 Finance.
You need to recommend options to ensure that you can provide customized financial reporting across the legal entities.
Solution: Create separate departments to manage functional areas.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content:
B - seems correct. Actually the exact things we are talling about is not that clear (pure financal reporting, or other financial performance reporting). If we take it as stated, Cost centers and Departements cannot provide such Financial Reporting on their own.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/fin-ops/organization-administration/plan-organizational-hierarchy
No. Financial dimensions are inadequate to provide a solution when the data is separated by legal entity.

comments.content: True, but this is not the question here. We are asked whteher Departments can provide Financial Reporting for themselves, which is not possible. The questions didn't mention any Cost management reporting.

discussion.content: Yes - Department - An operating unit that represents a category or functional part of an organization that performs a specific task, such as sales or accounting. It is used to report on functional areas. A department can have profit and lose responsibility and consist of a group of cost centers.
The answer should be Yes: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/fin-ops/organization-administration/plan-organizational-hierarchy
Seems correct. Cost center and departments are to separate reporting, not management of things
